en: My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter; I speak the things which I have made touching the king: My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
hmr: Ka lungril hi thil ṭhain a liem zar zar a; Laltak chungchâng thuha ka thil phuok chu ka hril ding a nih: Ka lei hi lekhaziek thiemtak kawlawm a nih.

en: Thou art fairer than the children of men; Grace is poured into thy lips: Therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
hmr: Mihriem nauhai nêk hin i hmêl a ṭha lem a, Lunginsietna hi i hmûra chun buok a nih; Chuleiin, Pathienin kumkhuoa dingin mal a sâwm che a nih.

en: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, Thy glory and thy majesty.
hmr: Aw mi hrât, i kâwlhnâm i kâwngah vawng rawh. I ropuina le i mawina leh.

en: And in thy majesty ride on prosperously, Because of truth and meekness and righteousness: And thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
hmr: Thutak le thuhnuoirawlna le felna leiin, I mawina inbelin, aitluongtakin sakawr chunga chuongin fe pei rawh. Chuongchun, i kut changtieng chun thil râpthlâktakhai ân chûktir ding che a nih.

en: Thine arrows are sharp; The peoples fall under thee; They are in the heart of the king’s enemies.
hmr: I thal chu ân zum a, Laltak dotuhai lungkhura chun ân bûr zing a, Mi tin chu i hnuoiah an tlu hlak a.

en: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
hmr: Aw Pathien, i lalṭhungpha chu chatuonin a um ding a nih, Thlierbîkna nei lona lalhmawl chu i ram lalhmawl chu a nih.

en: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness: Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee With the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
hmr: Felna chu i ngainah a, rîtlona chu i theida kha; Chuleiin, Pathien, i Pathien chun i ruolhai nêka nasain, Hlimna hriek a nâl ta che hi.

en: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia; Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.
hmr: I silfên po po chu murra rim dâm, aloe rim dâm, thing- zungthak rim dâm ân nam rum rum a; Saihaa siem lal inhaia ṭingṭang chi tum tum ri hung suokhai chun a sukhlim che a ni hi.

en: Kings’ daughters are among thy honorable women: At thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
hmr: I nuhmei ṭhahai laia chun lalhai naunuhai an ṭhang veh a, I changtieng chun Ophir rângkachaka incheiin lalnu chu a ngîr a.

en: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; Forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house:
hmr: Aw ka naunu, ngai la, ngaituo la, na sit rawh; I mihai le i pa ina mihai chu theinghil rawh;

en: So will the king desire thy beauty; For he is thy lord; and reverence thou him.
hmr: Chuongchun, laltakin i hmêl ṭhatak hi a dit ding annâwm, Ama chu i Lalpa a ni sih a; chuongchun, ama chu chibai bûk hlak rawh.

en: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; The rich among the people shall entreat thy favor.
hmr: Tura naunu chu thilpêk chawi- in chutaka chun um a ta, Mi laia hausahai ngei chun i ditsakna hung ngên an tih.

en: The king’s daughter within the palace is all glorious: Her clothing is inwrought with gold.
hmr: Lal in sûnga lal naunu chu a ropui vêl vawng a, A silfên chu rângkachaka ṭiel mawi a nih.

en: She shall be led unto the king in broidered work: The virgins her companions that follow her Shall be brought unto thee.
hmr: Puon ṭhui mawi silin laltak kuomah ṭhuoi an ta, Ama zuitu nunghâk a ruolhai chu, I kuomah ṭhuoi an tih.

en: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be led: They shall enter into the king’s palace.
hmr: Lâwmtak le hlimtakin ṭhuoi an ta, Laltak ina chun lût an tih.

en: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, Whom thou shalt make princes in all the earth.
hmr: I pahai aiah i nauhai um an ta, Anni chu hnuoi chung po poa hin milienah siem i tih.

en: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: Therefore shall the peoples give thee thanks for ever and ever.
hmr: I hming hi suon po poa hriet zing dingin siem ka ta, Chuleiin, mi tinin kumkhaw- tluongin lâwmthu hril an tih.
